page_content:
*** CERC 2023 competition ***
On December 8-10, 2023, the Central European Championships in Team Programming 2023 took place at the University of Ljubljana in Slovenia. Nicolaus Copernicus University in Torun was represented by two teams: NCU1, composed of Pawel Aniszewski, Pawel Czarkowski and Lukasz Skabowski, and NCU2, composed of Jerzy Czarkowski, Alicja Kluczek and Mateusz Sobkowiak. The teams took 30th and 29th place, respectively, as a result of which UMK took 4th place among Polish universities, and NCU2 will compete in Prague in March for participation in next year's World Championships. The students' participation in the competition was financed by the Grants4NCUStudents program. The participants were prepared for the competition by NCU supervisors Dr. Lukasz Mikulski and Dr. Marcin Piatkowski. For more information, visit https://cerc2023.acm.si/

*** AMPPZ 2023 Competition ***
The 2023 Academic Championships of Poland in Team Programming took place at the University of Warsaw on November 3-5, 2023. Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń was represented by two teams, which consisted of students from the Computer Science Academic Circle. The UMK1 team consisted of Pawel Aniszewski, Pawel Czarkowski and Lukasz Skabowski, and the UMK2 team consisted of Jerzy Czarkowski, Alicja Kluczek and Mateusz Sobkowiak. The students' participation in the competition was funded by the Grants4NCUStudents program. The participants were prepared for the competition by KNI supervisors Dr. Łukasz Mikulski and Dr. Marcin Piątkowski. Detailed information about the competition can be found at: https://amppz.edu.pl/.

*** LAN Party (link: https://www.mat.umk.pl/web/kni/lan-party) ***
On the night from Friday to Saturday, November 24/25, 2023, the fifth edition of the "LAN Party" took place in the building of the Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science. Organized by the UMK Computer Science Academic Circle and the Faculty Council of Student Government of the WMiI UMK, the event was aimed at all students of the University. Participants competed together in computer and board games. Attractions included game tournaments, ping-pong, foosball and a cash advance tele-tournament. A traditional element of the event was pizza for all participants. 110 people took part. Sponsors supported the event by providing prizes, food, drinks and technical support. The next edition is planned for next year.

*** Organizational meeting 10.10.2023 ***.
You are invited to the organizational meeting of the student Scientific Circle of Informatics on Tuesday 10.10.2023r. at 18:00 in room L9. At the meeting we will talk about the activities of the circle in previous years and present the plans and opportunities of the circle for the current academic year. If you want to develop outside the classroom, participate in projects or workshops conducted by the club, take part in programming competitions or conferences, have your own proposals for the activities of the club, or just want to meet new people - come to the meeting.

*** Meetings on Tuesdays at 18:00 ***.
Dates and topics of future and past meetings can be found in the Calendar of meetings (link: https://www.mat.umk.pl/web/kni/kalendarz).
